prompt.title: Interactive AI & Technology Canvas Background Animation
prompt.description: Create a full-screen, interactive canvas-based background animation with an AI and Technology theme. The animation should run on the lowest z-index layer (behind all website content) and respond to user interactions (click, hover, touch).

core_functionality: Full viewport canvas element that auto-resizes on window resize
Positioned with z-index: -1 or as a fixed background layer
Must not interfere with website content interactions (pointer-events: none on canvas, but capture clicks via event delegation)
Responsive to both desktop and mobile devices
Performance optimized - pause animation when tab is not visible

neural_network_nodes.description: Floating circular nodes representing AI neurons/data points
neural_network_nodes.movement: Slow, organic floating motion with slight randomness
neural_network_nodes.glow_effect: Subtle outer glow matching node color

connection_lines.description: Dynamic lines connecting nearby nodes, simulating neural network connections
connection_lines.style: Gradient lines with varying opacity based on distance
connection_lines.animation: Pulse effect - opacity fluctuation to simulate data transfer

geometric_shapes.description: Floating geometric shapes (hexagons, triangles, squares) representing technology/data

particle_trails.description: Small particles that occasionally travel along connection lines
particle_trails.frequency: Random intervals, 2-5 active at any time

binary_rain.description: Subtle falling binary digits (0 and 1) in the background

grid_pattern.description: Very subtle grid/circuit pattern as base layer
grid_pattern.style: Dashed or dotted lines forming a perspective grid

click_interaction.description: When user clicks anywhere on the background
effects: Ripple wave effect expanding from click point
Nearby nodes get pushed away momentarily then return (magnetic repulsion)
Spawn 10-20 burst particles that fade out
Connection lines near click point briefly intensify/glow
Create a temporary 'energy burst' ring animation

mouse_hover_interaction.description: Continuous effect as mouse moves across screen
effects: Nodes within 100px radius gently attract toward cursor
Increase connection line opacity near cursor
Same as click effects on touch
Support multi-touch for multiple ripple points

color_palette.description: Colors optimized for Hans Gunawan's portfolio dark theme

cyan_primary.usage: Main nodes, primary connection lines, interaction highlights

orange_accent.usage: Secondary nodes, geometric shapes, particle bursts

soft_purple.usage: Geometric shapes, variety in visual elements

burst_particles.usage: Random colors for click burst particles

performance_optimizations: Use requestAnimationFrame for smooth animation loop
Use spatial hashing or quadtree for efficient proximity detection
Pause animation when document is hidden (visibilitychange event)
Reduce particle count on mobile devices
Use devicePixelRatio for crisp rendering on high-DPI displays

responsive_behavior.mobile: Reduce to 50% particles, disable binary rain

suggested_classes: Node - Represents a floating neural network node
Connection - Manages line connections between nodes
suggested_methods: spawnBurstParticles(x, y, count) - Create click particles
render() - Draw all elements to canvas

react_integration: Create as a React component with useRef for canvas
Use useEffect for initialization and cleanup
Handle resize with window event listener
Cleanup animation frame on component unmount
integration_notes.placement: Render as first child in main App component or inside the Home page component before other sections
integration_notes.css_requirement: Ensure parent container has position: relative and the main content has position: relative with z-index: 1 or higher

steps: 2. Create RippleEffect at click position with cyan_primary color
4. Apply temporary velocity to push nodes away (physics simulation)
5. Spawn 15 burst particles with random velocities and colors
6. Intensify connection lines near click point (increase opacity to 0.8)
7. After 300ms, nodes begin returning to original drift pattern
9. Ripple expands and fades over 1.5 seconds

metadata.website_theme: Dark theme with cyan (#40E0D0) and orange (#E8963A) accent colors
